[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Field: ciphertext] [IV/nonce reuse] If encryption uses nonces or IVs, can their reuse across multiple ciphertexts leak information or enable decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Field: ciphertext] [Authentication] Is ciphertext authenticated (e.g., with AEAD), or can attackers modify ciphertext without detection leading to arbitrary decrypted payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Integration] [Consensus bypass] Can validators skip decryption by accepting Decrypted variants directly in mempool, bypassing encrypted transaction validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Integration] [Gas metering] Is gas properly calculated for encrypted vs decrypted transactions? Can attackers exploit free decryption operations to DoS validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Integration] [Signature verification] Are signatures verified before or after decryption? Can unsigned encrypted payloads bypass authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Concurrency] [Race condition] If multiple threads access EncryptedPayload concurrently during parallel execution, can race conditions cause state corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Concurrency] [Double decryption] Can the same Encrypted payload be decrypted by multiple validators simultaneously, causing different decryption results due to timing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Error: bail!] [Non-deterministic errors] Can bail! errors propagate differently across validators due to environmental differences, causing consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Error handling] [Panic safety] Can any operations on EncryptedPayload panic (e.g., unwrap, index out of bounds), crashing validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Type: TransactionExecutable] [Type safety] Can unsafe code elsewhere cast EncryptedPayload to incompatible types, bypassing type safety checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Type: TransactionExtraConfig] [Config type confusion] Can TransactionExtraConfig be substituted with a different type through unsafe deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [DoS] [Deserialization complexity] Can deeply nested or recursive structures in serialized EncryptedPayload cause stack overflow during deserialization? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [DoS] [Hash DoS] Can attackers craft payloads with identical hashes to cause hash table collisions, degrading HashMap performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Replay] [Cross-chain replay] Can EncryptedPayload from one Aptos network be replayed on another network (testnet vs mainnet) if chain ID isn't included? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Replay] [Historical replay] Can old EncryptedPayload instances be replayed after protocol upgrades if versioning isn't enforced? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Information leak] [Timing side channel] Can timing differences between processing Encrypted, FailedDecryption, and Decrypted variants leak information about transaction contents? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Information leak] [Size correlation] Does ciphertext size directly correlate with plaintext size, allowing traffic analysis to infer transaction types? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Determinism] [Non-deterministic decryption] Can decryption produce different results across validators due to implementation differences, causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Determinism] [Floating point] If TransactionExecutable contains floating point operations, can rounding differences cause non-deterministic execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Upgrade] [Backward compatibility] Can adding new fields to EncryptedPayload enum variants break deserialization of old transactions during protocol upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Upgrade] [Migration attacks] During upgrades, can attackers exploit transition logic to convert Encrypted payloads into Decrypted without proper validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Access control] [Unauthorized decryption] Can non-validator nodes or unauthorized validators decrypt EncryptedPayload that should be restricted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Access control] [Key management] How are decryption keys managed? Can key compromise allow retrospective decryption of all historical encrypted transactions? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Economic] [Front-running] Can validators decrypt transactions early to front-run them in the same block, extracting MEV unfairly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/encrypted_payload.rs] [Economic] [Censorship] Can validators selectively fail to decrypt (claim FailedDecryption) for transactions they want to censor? (Medium)
